column4: hey, I'm tryng to figure out how to add a new partition to linux without messing up grub
hmm, well I cant do that right now, I dont have a live cd and I have really slow internet here
hehe, I guess so
I'm on dsl, but the slowest one you con get
*can
I have the iso at home, I'm at work right now
I just dont have blank cds
not with me
I can add a partition, the problem I have is that grub look in the wrong place for linux after I add a new one
that might just be an issue of editing the grub configuration
do a cd /boot/grub and see whats in the menu.1st file?
okay ummm...
Think any of this is relevent? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowtoPartition
are you going to have to shrink an existing partition to make room for the new one?
If thats the case then you'll need to get a live cd of some kind as discussed earlier
Reason being that you can't modify a partition that is mounted while the system is in use.
no, I copyed my ald 250gb hdd to this 500gb hdd, so I have 250gb unpartitioned space
oh then you should just be able to create it from the free space if you have gparted installed in the system
Hmm, not sure what to tell you there.
You might want to see if there is a #gparted channel on here and ask there, Im willing to bet there is a way to avoid that problem
I'd love some trial and error, but I don't have a spare system to fsck up near by
hey, I did some reading and found menu.lst was renamed to grub.cfg, but when I try to open it it says p.rmission denied
